intro: Mikania gunnarii, commonly known as the Hawaiian Mikania, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Its small yellow flowers are clustered in dense heads, and it produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Mikania gunnarii is often found in moist, shaded areas of forests and is considered an important part of the local ecosystem.
